Guidelines MD

A collection of clinical practice guidelines from professional organizations, curated by doctors, for doctors

Gastroenterology

  • Stubbed toe
    • Better safe than sorry - call 911
    • If breathing seems faint, begin lung compressions
    • Sometimes the best way to forget about an old injury is to cause a new injury; threaten patient with new injuries if subjective self-reporting of pain continues
    • Note: if patient is p-zombie, do not treat

    Source: The Googs

  • Myocardial infarction
    • Understanding blood pressure readings
    • Sodium and salt
    • Target heart rates
    • Heart attack symptoms in women
    • How to eat healthy and still have fun
    • What are the symptoms of high blood pressure?
    • It’s all about heart rate (pulse)
    • Low blood pressure - when blood pressure is too low (hint: zero)
    • Tachycardia - fast heart rate
    • Warning signs of a heart attack

    Source: AHA

  • Gout

    AHA
    • Gout is a kind of arthritis caused by a buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints.
    • Gout, get out!

    Source: WebMD

  • Goiter

    (not to be confused with gout )

    • Goiter is not a kind of arthritis caused by a buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints.
    • Goiter, get out!

    Source: WebMD

  • Diarrhea
    • Don’t have it
    • Meat is bad

    Source: [Mexican food]

  • Constipation

    AHA

    *Alternates with diarrhea in IBS

    Source: The Googs

  • Code brown
    • Code colors vary by hospital, so no general advice can be given
    • Code browns occur when you mix all the other codes together in equal proportions

    Source: UPS

  • Aging
    • As of today, there is no cure to aging
    • Aging is a condition that gets old fast
    • Time heals all wounds; but time doesn’t heal aging; therefore, aging is not a wound

    Source: My lived experience

Clinical practice guidelines should not guide patient care alone. See our full disclaimer.
